content.1: Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea, as the
content.3: Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.
content.4: And command thou the people, saying, Ye
content.5: Meddle not with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as a foot breadth; because I have given mount Seir unto Esau
content.6: Ye shall buy meat of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall also buy water of them for money, that ye may drink.
content.8: And when we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, through the way of the plain from Elath, and from Ezion-gaber, we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
content.10: The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims;
content.11: Which also were accounted giants, as the Anakims; but the Moabites call them Emims.
content.12: The Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime; but the children of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which the
content.14: And the space in which we came from Kadesh-barnea, until we were come over the brook Zered,
content.15: For indeed the hand of the
content.16: So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,
content.18: Thou art to pass over through Ar, the coast of Moab, this day:
content.20: (That also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt therein in old time; and the Ammonites call them Zamzummims;
content.21: A people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims; but the
content.22: As he did to the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, when he destroyed the Horims from before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day:
content.23: And the Avims which dwelt in Hazerim,
content.24: Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the river Arnon: behold, I have given into thine hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land: begin to possess
content.25: This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations
content.26: And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
content.27: Let me pass through thy land: I will go along by the high way, I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
content.28: Thou shalt sell me meat for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only I will pass through on my feet;
content.29: (As the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, and the Moabites which dwell in Ar, did unto me;) until I shall pass over Jordan into the land which the
content.30: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the
content.32: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.
content.34: And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed the men, and the women, and the little ones, of every city, we left none to remain:
content.35: Only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the spoil of the cities which we took.
content.37: Only unto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not,
